values:
LJ is dying! ;_;

Long live <s>the Queen</s> Facebook!

So, lordofdarkness, your LiveJournal reveals...



You are... 0% unique and 0% herdlike. When it comes to friends you are normal. In terms of the way you relate to people, you are wary of trusting strangers. Your writing style (based on a recent public entry) is intellectual.

Your overall weirdness is: 108

(The average level of weirdness is: 27.
You are weirder than 99% of other LJers.)

Find out what your weirdness level is!

I am so upset, I think I could cry for a week. I just finished watching the bonus features for Firefly and it's finaly hit home that it's over. I've been obsessed for the past week or so, watching episodes, every time I had a few minutes to myself, in my breaks at work, on the toilet, walking to the bike shed on my way home, finishing the last ten minutes of an episode in bed. I can't get enough of it. I've seen the film twice in the last couple of weeks (I know it's not a lot, but I don't have the kind of free time that I used to) and I think I'm going to have to watch the entire series over again starting tomorrow.

I feel like such a sad bastard, but I really loved this show. I shall probably go to bed every night for the rest of my life praying that when I wake up in the morning there will be an announcement that they're making a second series.

Now I should off to bed before my sleep deprivation makes me post more weird things.

What's better than a Ninja-Pirate, I hear you ask?

Well a Ninja-Pirate that's been turned into a Vampire of course!
*Mourns the death of the Cutty Sark*
Anyone round here use the mobile network 3? I was wondering what the reception was like, I've been told it's crap, but they do some good deals.

If there is at least one person in your life whom you consider a close friend, and whom you would not have met without the internet, post this sentence in your journal. There was going to be more but I don't have the time. :/

Well, that killed an hour. Some of it's right, some of it isn't. Must stay up till 5 or the clowns will eat me I'll fall asleep at work tomorrow night.

I miss being a lazy student bum. >.>
Erika and I got bored tonight and she decided to give me a make over, I think I look sexy.

<marquee><font size="10">I LOVE SUGAR!</font></marquee>


<center>*skips around the production floor with inhalers sellotaped to every inch of his body*</center>

So I am now a married man! Thank you to everyone that was there, I had a most excellent time, I only hope that everyone else enjoyed the day as much as me and my beautiful wife did.
Further pictures will follow, as I recieve them. P.S. Marriage level 1! :p

I would just like to say a huge 'Thank you' to everyone who was involved with my Stag do. I had a most excellent time.


I'd also like to say sorry to Chris, who couldn't make it.

Tomorrow Night, my brother is hosting a party at my Parents house. All are welcome. Bring your own booze. Turn up sometime in the evening. I'm not really sure. I believe Chris is organising this. Go bug him. Do it!

Lol, just discovered the amusement that is Atom Films. Thank you Erika for installing Stumble on my PC. Continuing Chris' Star Wars theme: Sith'd Blue Milk Return of Pink Five And these are quite good too: 911 Drink The Deal Breaker There's plenty of other stuff on there too, the Star Wars stuff is the best though.

So, Erika's back in the States for a week. I am quite quite lonely, and a little lost as to what to do with myself. I've never spent more than an hour(in total) alone in this house, it's a little strange.

She left yesterday, from Heathrow, in the midst of all this terrorist malarkey. She's still not home and thus I've still not received word from her. Her Mother was kind enough to let me know she had to stop over in Boston for the night and that she's tired but alright.

<lj-cut text="The infamous flight of doom">
So yeah, the airport, that was fun.
Supposed to fly out on Wednesday, but alas we got there a little late and they wouldn't let her on. The plane wasn't scheduled to leave for 45minutes, but apparently that's too late to check in. So we had to purchase a standby ticket and wait for the next plane that was going that way, to finish checking in and see if there was a free seat for her. $100 and 4hours later we found out there wasn't, and that we'd have to do the same thing all over again tomorrow. We didn't much fancy sitting around an airport all day, wating for someone else to miss their flight, so that we could have their seat. So we opted to pay an additional $151 to upgrade the standby ticket to an actual ticket, that would garantee her a seat on the 4pm plane.

We got back home just in time for me to leave to work, but knowing I had to do it all again the next day, I had to ring in and tell them I wasn't showing up. My boss was suprisingly understanding and gave me the day off as Holiday, so I didn't lose out on too much money this week (does mean one day less I'll be paid later on in the year though).

So then we're getting ready to leave the next morning when Erika flicks on the TV, to see a picture of a plane on the news. "uh oh, this can't be good". Not really what you want to hear just before you leave to get on a plane. It did however give us a chance to re-pack, knowing she wasn't going to be able to take any hand luggage on the plane with her.

Once we got there it wasn't so bad. There were loads of people queueing up outside waiting for their flight numbers to be called, but otherwise it was pretty much business as usual. All incomming flights had been cancelled and so had all flights to Europe, but other than long delays and the security team being on Red Alert (there were Police with machineguns everywhere and everyone getting on a plane was thoroughly searched and had their shoes x-rayed) flights to the US were going ahead as planned. The no hand luggage policy was a little extreem though. Everyone was given a clear plastic bag and the only things Erika was allowed to bring on with her was her Sunglasses, her Passport/plane tickets/wallet-thing and her athsma inhaler. No headache tablets, no books, no water/orange juice, no headphones. I understand most of the items, like anything electronic, or fluid in nature, but a book? What exactly can you conceal in a book that won't come up on an x-ray? They had to wait 6 hours for thier plane to take off, that kind of waiting time without music, a book, or a close friend can drive a person crazy! I know, I get paid a reasonable sum of money to endure 12hours of it a night. :p

*sigh* But all this kerfuffle is worthwhile if it means she's not blown out of the sky by some religious nutjob.

It'll be good to know when she's home safe and sound. I'm so glad I got an email from her mum shortly after I got in from work. I don't think I could have stayed up much longer waiting for word, but then I woundn't have been able to sleep either. Apparently she had to wait around for 6 hours for the plane to take off, then they ran out of time and had to stop in Boston, where they gave her a hotel room and plane tickets to Chicago on some afternoon flight. I expected her to be home an hour ago, but I'm sure I'll get word soon.

Hmm I seem to have written more than I expected perhapse an LJ-cut will prevent the scaring off of my imaginary readers.
</lj-cut>

Ugh, so, after spending 4 hours on a train and 4 hours at heathrow airport, I then had to cycle to work for a nice 12hour shift. I was pretty knackered when I got home, and have thus spent all day sleeping. My sleep pattern for the weekend is now going to be pretty screwed up. :/

So I'm free this weekend and I'm likely to be quite bored and lonely. If anyone has any plans or wants to meet up and do something let me hear your suggestions. I may just lose myself in computergames. Today could be a good time to install Oblivion.
<marquee><font size="10">THIS TRAIN IS FOR COCK</font><font size="0.5">FOSTERS</font></marquee>

I am SO fucking bored! I could kill myself. It doesn't help that some of the lines are down and almost everyone from my usual team is either off tonight or working elsewhere, so I have to work with people from the other lines. Most of whom I don't mind but two of which are just irritating the fuck out of me. Maybe I'm just pissed off because the Iroquai decided to wipe me off the face of the planet before I came to work. *must play more Civ III* :p Anyway, on a different note, I kind of fancy playing some Halo 2 or something this weekend if anyone's up for it. I'm willing to host, but I don't own an X Box which could prove problematic. Also if someone else hosts, and someone picks me up, I'm happy to bring along my 32" Flatscreen TV to play it on. I highlighted keywords in order to grab the attention of those who skimmed past this entry after reading the first line. Get back to me people.

<center><Font size="20">Happy Birthday Sachwaaaaaah!</Center></font>

I hope it was a good one, sorry I didn't make it. :/

It's not so bad now, they got 3 of the lines up and running after lunch, but currently they're all broken, so I'm stuck doing nothing again. *whistles*

Mike hurry up and join my shift so we can have pallet truck races and advair football. :p

I am so bored.

None of the lines are running. So we're all sat around doing nothing. I drew a chess board on a piece of card and cut some pieces out of red and white paper, but half way into a game with one of the new starters, Brian (who's been a temp here for over 2 years) came over and gave his speech on how if we're caught playing games we'll be sacked and that we have to just stand around and do nothing. Then he started a game of Eye-Spy. Now no-one will play with me. Topics of cenversation include football (bleh) and Adrian complaining about the HR Depatment because he's bitter that he didn't get a permanent job.

I've only got enough training left to keep me busy for maybe an hour or two. I'm tempted to take a half day, but I need the money. :/

I'm also pretty tired and want nothing more than to be snuggled up in a nice warm bed. :|

Maybe I'll print off some Sudoku puzzles or something...
I'd like to say a quick sorry to <lj user="wakaba_chan"> and <lj user="celticmyst"> for not stopping to say hi when I passed them this evening. Forgive me, I was running late for work.

I am bored!

I've spent almost all night cleaning machinery, and now there's nothing to do.

I want to go home.

I just got recognised by my 5th Grade Teacher, Mrs Lucy Ashcroft. I almost didn't recognise her at first glance, and had to do a double take. It has been 11 or so years since I had regular contact with her. She was one of my favourite teachers over the years, called herself The Sarky Devil. (I have no idea how you would spell that, it doesn't seem to be a real word, needless to say she liked her sarcasm).

She was saying she saw me in Ware a while back when I had long hair, and thought, "oooh, that was Andrew" where as someone else approached her in Tescos recently and said Hi, and she had no idea who they were. It's nice to know not only did she leave a lasting impression on me, but I must have left enough of one on her too that she still recognises me a decade later, with stupid hair and 2 stone of extra weight.

I miss education. :|

Guh, The Estate agents rang me today, and started fucking us about. Looks like we're going to have to give up the place we'd found and I'm going ot have to get my booking fee back. And now we have to get the papers out start looking for somewhere else. We could only find two places that allowed pets in the Hertford and Ware area, both expensive, one of which was a shit hole, the other of which turns out to have a dodgy landlord.

You think you have one of your many promblems done and dusted and it comes back to bite you in the arse.

In other news I feel lousy. I've got some stupid head cold or something. My throat is sore, my nose is blocked and leaky, my Sinuses sting like a thousand wasps are using my face as target practice and my head is throbbing. My usual pills aren't helping, and my last two night shifts have been hell.
Sean Bean's back! After 9 years of film making he's come back to play Sharpe once more as he defends British soil in India. I can't wait. ^_^

Hello all.

I have the weekend off, and for once don't have an aweful lot planned. As such I don't really know what to do with it. Your suggestions would be appreciated. Bear in mind I'm feeling a little on the ill side, so nothing too physically intensive, and I've got lots to pay for this year, so nothing too expensive.

I'm so unbelievably bored. I've been passing the time by making a Sanity Harness, Crown of Protection, and Beard of Wisdom.
I started with the Sanity Harness. A belt of sorts that I made out of cable ties, that wrapped around my waist about 8 times. And when people asked me why, I told them it was to hold my sanity in. And that it was commonly believed that sanity leaks out of the ears or nose, but in actuality it leaks from the belly button.
Richard however, after giggling to some of the other staff about me came up to me and said that it could prove a potential UIR (Unusual Incident Report) and that hypethetically if I was to reach into a machine to fix a fault one of the ties could fall off and get stuck in the machine and damage one of the stations. So I took it off.

But the boredom of monotony drove me to construct a crown, that really happened by accident. I was just messing with the cable ties, trying to find a less slap dash and more secure way of making a Sanity Harness when I found myself holding the Crown of Protection. It was on my head for no longer than 2 minutes before Adrian walking past said that if anyone important catches me wearing that...*trails off into the distance*

The Beard of Wisdom was pretty boring, and irritating, so I only wore that for a few minutes before discarding it. We have to take the sticky labels off the bags of components and discard them in a special blue bin bag for disposal (because they have batch numbers and barcodes and stuff on them that glaxo wants incinerated, or something) and I just stuck a load to my chin and started stroking them like the guy from Kill Bill 2.

I'm running out of ways to amuse myself, might try doodling on my lab coat.

I've decided I'm rather insane.

I remembered half an hour ago that I forgot to take any hot cross buns to work with me. This makes me sad. =[

I don't want to be here anymore. I'm thinking if the need arises I'll get fired by sitting bollock naked in one of the component hoppers, it's original and I'll be remembered.

Arg. It's going to be one of those nights. I've written the wrong number on more than 9 trays already, and I was bored after 5 minutes of starting and tired after an hour. I'll have been awake 24 hours before this shift is over. :/
My trainer's not here either. Which not only means I wont be able to learn anything new, but it also means my main source of amusement here is missing. He's the only one here I really have anything in common with, and he's a complete nutcase.
Although saying that Lee said he'd show me how to do a line clearance on the coiling machine (yeah I know that makes no sense to anyone here, but I don't care) after break, so that'll be interesting at least.

I miss you my love.

Was thinking of taking a half day tomorrow/tonight(Thursday) so that I could go to the Marquee Club. One of the guys I work with, who happens to be nice enough to give me a lift into work when it's raining, plays rhythm guitar for History Of Guns, thought I'd go see what they're like. Wondered if anyone wanted to join me, he said he thinks they'll be playing at about 8:30/9pm so there'll still be time for the usual puppage afterwards. Edit: Ignore this post, I can't get the time off. =[

Ok, so making some plans for my wedding and currently I've got the Church booked for Saturday the 23rd of September 2006, but I'm having trouble finding a hall for the wedding reception that's free on the same day. So, if anyone knows of any suitable locations for a wedding reception in the hertford area your suggestions would be welcome, otherwise we're looking to have the wedding and reception on the Friday (the 22nd of September 2006). I know I've not sent out invitations yet, but I've verbally invited most of the guests already and I was just wondering if any of you were going to have any major problems making it on either of those days.

And, before you say "but I have to work on Fridays/Saturdays" or some other bullshit like that, IT'S MY WEDDING, you'll take the day off! If you don't I'll burn said place of work to the ground, you can't miss my wedding because of work if you've got no job to go to. *cackles in an evil yet quite mad manner*

I was compared to Stephen Hawkin today. 
We were standing around before starting the line up discussing the day's plans and stuff, the line leader asked my trainer if he was going to train Adrian on the coiler today, and me on the test machine and he said sure, I'll do Adrian first and Andrew after break. Then Phil (the line leader) said "if he can stay awake today" (I'm never going to live that down) and Neil (my trainer) was like "oh he'll just stand there while I teach him everything, it'll be a piece of piss to him, mentally, but physically it'll be impossible. He's a mental genious, but physically retarded. Like Stephen Hawkin, but without the wheels."

*shrugs* I thought it was amusing, maybe you had to be there. :p

Ugh, I'm having trouble fighting the voices today. :|

Shit! Shit, shit, shit!

I watched my brother playing Sims 2 for a couple of hours last night, and now I find myself wanting to play. :|

I feel so dirty.

Welcome to:
Who Wants To Be A Best Man!
 *theme music* In the first round contestants will be asked a series of questions about the groom and the wedding such as "What do you do if you can't find the wedding rings?" The second round will be a test of physical endurance and reflex, to ensure that when, yes that's right WHEN the groom passes out he will be there to catch him. Constestants who make it to the third round will then have ten minutes to plan a suitable Stag Night, which has to be approved by the groom before they can move onto the final round. In the final round each of the remaining contestants has a further ten minutes to write a rough speach which they must each then give in turn. The person who gives the best speach will then be made my best man. =P

I justrealised I only ever update when I'm really bored, or depressed. I feel sorry for all of you that only know me/have contact with me via LJ. It doesn't make me look like a very well rounded individual. I assure you I can actually be fun to be around. :P

I've decided I'm going to try and spend the day alternating between the internet and helping out on the lines that are still running (2 out of 5). That way it doesn't looke like I'm not doing anything all day, and it means I'm not stood round fighting over things to do with people the whole time either. Although saying that half the staff are just gathered round chatting, but if someone important comes by we need to look like we're keeping busy.
I wish I could just go home and still get paid. :p

Bugger, apparently my line isn't running today because there's been a problem at the warehouse ordering parts, or something. Which means half the other liens aren't running either. My trainer has just gone off to Hospital and won't be back til Monday (he said he was passing blood or something :S seems ok). So it looks like I'm sat doing nothing for 12 hours :| I don't think I'm supposed to be on the internet, I should be finding something to help out with somewhere, or something. :/ I'm not sure how I'm going to keep from driving myself insane. :| In other news, for all of you that don't have access to 's journal, we are now engaged. ^_^

ok, so I'm not as depressed anymore, just tired, really really tired. I feel kind of numb now, I just want to sleep. I've spent the past hour reading training files on the computer and just about every member of staff in the building has had to tell me to wake up once or twice. Maybe they'll fire me and I can go home and sleep. 4 hours sleep isn't enough and I need to start eating more than one meal a day, is it any wonder I feel so shit? Oh well, only 7 hours left, then I can cycle home in the rain and sleep.

I miss you Erika.
